project.teaser: Higher Education Institutions (HEIs) can have a strong positive impact on regional and Europe-wide social and economic development through education, research and engagement. However, they require targeted, methodological and experienced support to enhance their capability to...
project.objective:
Higher Education Institutions (HEIs) can have a strong positive impact on regional and Europe-wide social and economic development through education, research and engagement. However, they require targeted, methodological and experienced support to enhance their capability to fully realise their potential.
Accelerate_FutureHEI responds to the above-mentioned needs through the development and testing of acceleration services to support HEI institutional transformation involving:
- A robust, comprehensive methodology that is designed to transform and impact not just the HEIs but also their regions. It does so by taking an evidence-based approach that identifies the needs of the individual HEIs whilst also benefitting from an efficient universal approach that enables them to learn from each other. - Underpinned by a change management process, the project offers an acceleration support system that builds on the status quo, develops a connected vision and set of activities described in a roadmap and is then executed in application projects supported with coaching, training and international exchange. - Consortium built for success and impact as the project and overall methodology for acceleration services is designed, led and monitored by proven, globally-recognised experts specialised in implementing acceleration services to effect change at HEIs through entrepreneurship, innovation and engagement. - The consortium offers the right setting for a pilot program to deliver a meaningful context-connected, practical outcomes for a committed and diversified set of 14 partners, uniting 2 established EIT HEI Initiative consortia, where impact would make a real difference in their regions. - Sustained impact will be achieved as HEIs will have developed strong internal understanding of status quo and desired future state; designed and executed a roadmap & application projects; received expert coaching, training and peer learning in a network that will sustain beyond the project timeline
project.title: Entrepreneurial & Innovative Universities Acceleration Programme
project.keywords: Entrepreneurial & Innovative University, HEI Transformation, Cultural Change, Regional Innovaion Ecosystems, Regional Engagement

result.title: Final Analysis Report: Common challenges and solutions to becoming more entrepreneurial and innovative
result.description: Based on analysis of the roadmaps, this report includes a summary of insights and common challenges faced by universities, and informs the key areas for the development of WP6 Capacity Building & Knowledge Exchange, as well as WP4 Acceleration Services Pilot-test for forming theme-based working groups for knowledge exchange and acceleration services implementation.

result.title: Capacity Building Program – Delivery progress report & updated plan
result.description: Update on the sessions delivered so far and plan for the remainder of the project.

result.title: Synthesis Report: Key findings on current state analysis
result.description: 2 Synthesis report: Key findings on current state analysis (M12) –a summary of key learnings and findings from (i) pre-scanning, (ii) asset mapping, (iii) focus groups, (iv) survey in a form of the synthesis report summarizing findings and insights, emphasizing common and specific challenges associated with the institutional transformation across all testing partners. While the synthesis report is produced in English, the partners develop executive summaries in partner national languages to ensure higher impact of the deliverable.

result.title: Initial Communication, Dissemination and Sustainability Plan
result.description: The dissemination plan is prepared by the WP leader MMS and highlights in detail (i) target groups, (ii) channels and multipliers, (iii) goals, (iv) dissemination and sustainability strategies, (v) operational activities and instruments, (vi) responsibilities, milestones and project timeline, (vii) expected impact of the dissemination activities.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: Data Management Plan (M6, 24, 48) will be prepared, detailing what data the project will generate and make accessible for verification and re-use, and how it will be curated and preserved. The main principles of this plan are: (i) identification of data types and research deliverables, (ii) findability, (iii) accessibility, (iv) interoperability, (v) reusability and (vi) curation and storage/preservation costs. The DMP will be updated mid and end of the project.

result.title: Strategic vision statements towards becoming Entrepreneurial and Innovative Universities
result.description: Based on pre-scanning and focus groups, each testing partner develops a strategic vision towards becoming Entrepreneurial & Innovative University – a document outlining strategic vision statement that describes their desired transformation high-level objective as well as their motivations, ambitions and strengths to achieve it.

result.title: Interim Communication, Dissemination and Sustainability Report
result.description: Following the first review, the plan will be updated and an interim report will be developed outlining key activities undertaken so far.

result.title: Initial Summary Report of common issues/pitfalls related to ITAP
result.description: Insights gathered from the ITAP working session and working group workshops will be collected and synthesized into an initial report to share common issues beyond the testing partners.

result.title: ITAP Progress Report
result.description: Summary report based on interim reports created by testing partners after each Impact capturing workshop describing their ITAP development and implementation progress.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - Accelerate_FutureHEI (Entrepreneurial & Innovative Universities Acceleration Programme)
result.teaser: The Entrepreneurial & Innovative Universities Accelerator Program - Accelerate Future HEI, is an initiative led by the University Industry Innovation Network (UIIN). This initiative brings together twelve European partners from eleven countries with the ambitious goal of...

category.title: Report Summary

result.title: Draft Analysis report: Common challenges and solutions to becoming more entrepreneurial and innovative
result.description: Common challenges and solutions to becoming more entrepreneurial and innovative (M12) – initial findings on key challenges faced by the testing partners following the roadmap workshops

result.title: Capacity Building Program - Overview and delivery plan
result.description: Design of the program that includes the framework and agenda for the (i) cohort knowledge exchange events, and (ii) accelerate training workshops.

result.title: Initial Policy briefing
result.description: Initial report to capture the main policy findings

result.title: Monitoring & evaluation Plan
result.description: Plan for monitoring and evaluation that includes impact evaluation strategy that sets out the evaluation guidelines and criteria, whilst providing evidence of the impact and value added of the acceleration services and implementation activities by the testing partners.

result.title: Updated Communication, Dissemination and Sustainability Plan and Initial Report
result.description: Updated plan and initial report on activities to date. This includes development of project website and corporate design guide and promotion materials, project website, Corporate design guide and promotion materials.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
